refnamediv.refpurpose: An application status and progress bar widget

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "has-progress" gboolean : Read / Write / Construct "has-status" gboolean : Read / Write / Construct "interactivity" GnomePreferencesType : Read / Write / Construct

refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
Description
refsect1.para: A GnomeAppBar widget sits (usually) at the bottom of an application window and contains a progress bar (for indicating time consuming tasks and their completion status) and/or a status bar for sending short one-line message to the user. It is also possible (in theory) for the user to edit the contents of the status bar, should the application developer choose to allow that, however note that this is not really working in the present implementation, so developers are recommended to avoid using interactive status bars and use proper editable widgets instead.

refsect2.title: GNOME_APPBAR_HAS_STATUS()
refsect2.para: Whether or not the application bar contains a status box.

listitem.simpara: TRUE is a status box is contained in the appbar.

refsect2.title: GNOME_APPBAR_HAS_PROGRESS()
refsect2.para: Whether or not the application bar contains a status box.

listitem.simpara: TRUE is a status box is contained in the appbar.

refsect2.title: GNOME_APPBAR_INTERACTIVE()
refsect2.para: Whether or not the user can edit the text in the statusbar portion of a GnomeAppBar instance.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the user can edit the statusbar text.

refsect2.title: struct GnomeAppBar
refsect2.para: This widget contains the status bar and progress bar (if they are requested). After creating a GnomeAppBar widget (via gnome_appbar_new(), for example), it can then be passed to gnome_app_set_statusbar() to add it to the main application window.

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new GNOME application status bar. If has_progress is TRUE, a small progress bar widget will be created, and placed on the left side of the appbar. If has_status is TRUE, a status bar, possibly an editable one, is created.

The interactivity parameter determines whether the appbar is an interactive "minibuffer" or just a status bar. If it is set to GNOME_PREFERENCES_NEVER, it is never interactive. If it is set to GNOME_PREFERENCES_USER we respect user preferences from ui-properties. If it's GNOME_PREFERENCES_ALWAYS we are interactive whether the user likes it or not. Basically, if your app supports both interactive and not (for example, if you use the gnome-app-util interfaces), you should use GNOME_PREFERENCES_USER. Otherwise, use the setting you support. Please note that "interactive" mode is not functional now; GtkEntry is inadequate and so a custom widget will be written eventually.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if appbar needs progress bar widget, FALSE if not.
TRUE if appbar needs status bar widget, FALSE if not.

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_set_status ()
refsect2.para: Sets the status label without changing widget state; next call to gnome_appbar_set_status() or gnome_appbar_push() will destroy this permanently.

listitem.simpara: Text to which status label will be set.

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_get_status ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the statusbar widget.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the statusbar widget.

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_set_default ()
refsect2.para: What to show when showing nothing else is on the stack; defaults to the empty string.

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_push ()
refsect2.para: Push a new status message onto the status bar stack and display it.

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_pop ()
refsect2.para: Remove current status message, and display previous status message, if any. It is fine to call this with an empty stack.

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_clear_stack ()
refsect2.para: Remove all status messages from appbar, and display default status message (if present).

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_set_progress_percentage ()
refsect2.para: Sets progress bar to percentage.

listitem.simpara: Percentage to which progress bar should be set.

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_get_progress ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the progress bar widget for further manipulation.

listitem.simpara: A GtkProgressBar widget which is appbar's progress bar, or NULL if appbar has no progress bar.

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_refresh ()
refsect2.para: Refresh the status message bar by redrawing the item on the top of the stack, or the default value if the stack is empty.. Useful to force the message from a previous call to gnome_appbar_set_status() to disappear.

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_set_prompt ()
refsect2.para: Put a prompt in the appbar and wait for a response. When the user responds or cancels, a 'user_response' signal is emitted.

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_clear_prompt ()
refsect2.para: Remove any prompt from the status message bar.

refsect2.title: gnome_appbar_get_response ()
refsect2.para: Get the response to the prompt, if any.

listitem.simpara: Text from appbar entry widget, as entered by user. This string should be freed by the caller (using gfree()) when no longer required.

refsect2.title: The "has-progress" property
refsect2.para: Create a progress widget.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "has-status" property
refsect2.para: Create a status widget.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "interactivity" property
refsect2.para: Level of user activity required.
Default value: GNOME_PREFERENCES_NEVER

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
